title: Business Analyst to Process Automation for Nordic-Baltic region
company: Oil and Gas Job Search Ltd
description:
**Business Analyst - Process Automation**
**Vill du vara en del av ett företag med ambitiös tillväxtplan med fokus på hållbarhet och goda lärande- och utvecklingsmöjligheter samtidigt som du formar den digitala transformationen för morgondagens automationslösningar? Då vill vi gärna lära känna dig!**
**Vad kommer du att göra?**
**I rollen som Business Analyst** 
 kommer du ha ett brett spektrum av ansvarsområden och vara en viktig länk i processen från försäljning till leverans. Du kommer att ha en viktig roll i anbudsfasen, där du kommer att samarbeta med säljteamet för att utveckla de bästa lösningar för våra kunder. Du kommer även att dokumentera den tekniska lösningen, beräkna ingenjörsinsatsen och formulera kraven på projektleverans utifrån omfattning.
   

  

 När kunden har signerat anbudet kommer du att säkerställa den röda tråden genom hela projektet och stötta leveransteamet för att säkerställa att vi levererar rätt lösning och att kundvärdet realiseras enligt såld omfattning.
   

  

 I projekt kommer du tillsammans med projektteamet och kund, gå igenom den tekniska lösningen, tydliggöra förväntad funktionalitet. Du kommer att ge teknisk support till projektet för övergripande frågor och hjälpa till med testning för att säkerställa efterlevnad av krav. Vid behov närvarar du även vid acceptanstester, både internt samt tillsammans med kund för att säkra kvaliteten på leveransen. Du kommer även att driva tekniska förändringar och tillägg som uppstår under projektets gång vid behov.
   

  

**Vad kommer göra dig framgångsrik i rollen?**
* Vi söker dig med erfarenhet av automationsprojekt och gedigen teknisk kunskap. Du har erfarenhet av att skriva tekniska lösningar och har förmåga att beräkna kostnader för att lösa uppgifter.
* Du har förmåga att sätta dig in i kundens processer och se kundens behov.
* Du är självgående, analytisk och har förmågan att arbeta strukturerat mot uppsatta mål. Du har även god ledarskap- och kommunikationsförmåga.
* Du har god förmåga att planera och prioritera ditt arbete för att kunna hantera kundförfrågningar med korta ledtider där snabb återkoppling krävs.
* Goda kunskaper i el och hårdvaruarkitektur.
* God kunskap i engelska gällande både tal och skrift.
* Du delar Schneider Electric's kärnvärden - IMPACT ( Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action Curiosity, Teamwork).


**Vad har vi att erbjuda dig?**
* Flexibilitet: Med vår globala policy för flexibilitet på jobbet och vår hybridarbetsmodell ger vi våra medarbetare möjlighet att integrera deras arbetsliv.
* Karriärutveckling: Vi tillhandahåller en rik miljö för våra medarbetare att växa och lära sig varje dag genom vår karriärutvecklingsmodell.
* Förmåner: Schneider Electric erbjuder ett robust förmånspaket för att stödja våra anställda, såsom betald familjeledighet, en välbefinnandekultur och mycket mer.
* Inkluderande miljö: Vi bygger en kultur av respekt där alla känner sig trygga att vara sina autentiska jag. Vi är helt engagerade i inkludering, och vår policy och kultur speglar detta engagemang.


**Fick vi dig inspirerad?**
 Låt oss lära oss om dig. Ansök idag! Vi tillsätter tjänsten så snart vi hittar en lämplig kandidat.
   

  

 Observera att vi utför en bakgrundsverifiering som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess.
   

  

**Why us?**
 Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.
   

  

 ₠34bn global revenue
   

  

 128 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   

  

 45% of revenue from IoT
   

  

 5% of revenue devoted for R&D
   

  

 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled
   

  

 It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

title: Enterprise Architect (Presales) Enablement Lead
description:
****Your work days are brighter here.****
 At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.
   

  

**About The Team**
 As an Enterprise Architect Enablement Lead, you'll play a key role on the Global Solution Consulting Strategy & Enablement team with a focus on EMEA. You'll be part of an organization that directly impacts our sales and business success. This team is passionate about growing skills, improving career opportunities, and enabling the field on Workday's outstanding technology.
   

  

 The vision of the team is to enable Solution Consulting to deliver best-in-class demonstrations and presentations and enable all levels within the organization.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will be charged with:
   

  

**Analyzing**
* Onboarding progress and identifying the biggest enablement gaps for new hires
* Skills/Enablement gaps for all Workmates
* Program gaps to support your key persona


**Effectiveness of current course curriculum, certifications, training, etc**
* Develop courses and enablement to support role ramp up as well as tenured solution consulting development and new products/offerings
* Update existing courses/enablement programs for new and existing products/offerings and other identified gaps or new opportunities. These could be product as well as skills courses/programs.


**Develop, lead and support through delivery of content tracks for Solution Consulting Events**
* Teach demonstration and sales skills by developing scalable training that can be delivered/tailored to your specific persona
* Mentor and instruct new solution consulting workmates on aspects of the product that are needed for demo success
* Deliver and facilitate enablement programs focused on product as well as skills. Virtually as well as in person.
* Mentor and coach solution consulting workmates through their certification process


**About You**
 You are passionate about helping others achieve success. You have a vision and you are effective at coordinating, designing and delivering on that vision. You bring your passion for learning, solution consulting, and technology to every interaction with your team and your partners. You love to explore new ways to make learning effective, easy, and fun!
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
 5+ years in software solution consulting
   

  

 3+ years in Workday solution consulting with focus on oCIO
   

  

**Other Qualifications**
* Outstanding ability to build and maintain relationships and expectations with partners, supporting organizations, and peers
* Experience with modern enablement strategies, methodologies, and technologies
* Excellent presentation, communication, facilitation and organizational skills that help lead and deliver projects, programs, and initiatives
* Willing to travel up to 50% of the time


 Workday is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.
   

  

 Further, pursuant to applicable local ordinances, Workday will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
   

  

 You may view the Workday's Pay Transparency Policy, and Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law notice, by clicking on their corresponding links.
   

  

 Workday is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans during our application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, contact us at accommodations@workday.com.
   

  

**Our Approach to Flexible Work**
 With Flex Work, we’re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply
 **spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field** 
 with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.
   

  

**Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!**
 ,

title: Key Account Manager Engineering, Procurement & Construction (EPC)
company: Oil and Gas Job Search Ltd
description:
**Key Account Manager EPC's, Sweden**
 Would you like to join one of the world's most sustainable companies as our new Key Account Manager for Engineering, Procurement & Construction (EPC) accounts and develop further your career in exciting and fast-growing areas tied to the green energy transition?
   

  

 Do you feel at home in a professional innovative environment with renewable developers, entrepreneurs, and EPC partners working on electrification and decarbonization of our society? If yes, then this might be the right opportunity for you!
   

  

**In the Key Account Manager EPC's role,** 
 you will be responsible for customer relations on existing clients and sales generation on prospects of Schneider Electric's products and Ecostruxure solutions to EPC accounts in Sweden, both domestic and international EPC's. You will drive our growth into this channel and be responsible for major accounts with international exposure.
   

  

 The position can be based in
 **Stockholm, Göteborg, Sundsvall or Luleå in Sweden.**
**What You Will Do**
 As the Key Account Manager, you will be responsible for understanding the unique needs of EPC customers, identifying opportunities for collaboration, and promoting the adoption of renewable energy and smart grid technologies. Your efforts will play a vital role in advancing sustainability initiatives tied to the green energy transition, and facilitating the transition to a more resilient and green energy landscape. In this role you will be:
   

  

* Owning selected National Accounts, focusing on EPC channel
* Developing and executing growth strategies, delivering the strategic EcoStruxure Intent
* Collaborating with matrix management contacts to deploy Energy Management strategies
* Identifying new customers and driving pipeline growth through opportunity creation and management
* Describing, advising and proactively working on the electrical architecture
* Preparing, offering and negotiating on tender projects
* Customer relationship management at all levels and ensuring customer satisfaction
* Collection and process of market information
* Ensuring the applicable sales targets


**What We Are Looking For**
 To be successful in the role, we see that you have:
   

  

* Relevant educational background such as bachelors degree or higher in an energy related field
* Previous professional experience in sales with major projects and solutions sales
* Understanding of different kind of business models such as EPC, EPC(M) etc, electrical infrastructure industry, and account planning is beneficial
* Great communication and interpersonal skills
* Proactive and dynamic approach to business development
* Passionate about building networks and tailoring offers to customer requirements
* Effective communication skills in Swedish is benefecial and fluent English with excellent verbal, written and presentation skills


**What do we offer you?**
 At Schneider Electric, We Are Committed To Fostering a Vibrant And Inclusive Work Culture Where Every Employee Is Empowered To Thrive. As Part Of Our Team, You Can Expect
   

  

* Professional Growth: Access to continuous learning opportunities, mentorship programs, and career development resources to nurture your potential and drive your career forward.
* Innovative Environment: Be part of a dynamic, forward-thinking organization that encourages creativity, innovation, and entrepreneurial spirit as we lead the way in digital transformation and sustainability.
* Work-Life Balance: We value your well-being and offer flexible work arrangements, comprehensive wellness programs, and support to help you maintain a healthy work-life balance.
* Global Impact: Contribute to meaningful projects that address global energy challenges and sustainability, making a positive impact on the world while advancing your career.
* Inclusive Community: Join a diverse and inclusive community where your unique perspectives are celebrated, and your voice is heard, fostering an environment of collaboration and belonging.


**Did we get you inspired?**
 Please submit your application by 14th of June 2024. We will start going through the application after the application deadline has been closed.
   

  

**Why us?**
 At Schneider Electric we're committed to creating a workplace that gives you not just a job but a
 **meaningful** 
 purpose in joining our mission to bring energy and efficiency to enable life, progress and sustainability for all.
   

  

 We believe in
 **e** 
**mpowering** 
 our team members to reach their full potential, fostering a sense of ownership in their work.
   

  

 We embrace
 **inclusion** 
 as a fundamental value, ensuring that every voice is heard and valued. We value differences, and welcome people from all walks of life. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone, everywhere.
   

  

 If you want to be part of a company where your contributions truly matter, where you are empowered to make a difference and where inclusivity is valued, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 Discover your
 **M** 
**eaningful, Inclusive** 
 and
 **Empowered** 
 career at Schneider Electric.
   

  

 ₠34.2bn global revenue
   

  

 +12% organic growth
   

  

 135 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   

  

 #1 on the Global 100 World's most sustainable corporations
   

  

 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled
   

  

 Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best.
   

  

 We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate and we 'embrace different' as one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do. This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.
   

  

 You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion here and our DEI Policy here
   

  

 Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color , gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.

title: Executive Director, Nordics
description:
The International Rescue Committee (IRC) responds to the world’s worst humanitarian crises, helping to restore health, safety, education, economic wellbeing, and power to people devastated by conflict and disaster. Founded in 1933 at the call of Albert Einstein, the IRC is one of the world's largest international humanitarian non-governmental organizations (INGO), at work in more than 50 countries and more than 25 U.S. cities helping people to survive, reclaim control of their future and strengthen their communities. A force for humanity, IRC employees deliver lasting impact by restoring safety, dignity and hope to millions. If you're a solutions-driven, passionate change-maker, come join us in positively impacting the lives of millions of people world-wide for a better future.
   

  

 Generalsekreterare till International Rescue Committee i Sverige
   

  

 Är du en inspirerande ledare som vill göra skillnad för människor drabbade av konflikter och katastrofer?
   

  

 Om IRC
   

  

 International Rescue Committee (IRC) grundades 1933 på initiativ av Albert Einstein och är en internationell humanitär organisation med verksamhet i över 40 länder i världen. Vårt uppdrag är att hjälpa människor som är drabbade av konflikter eller katastrofer att överleva, återhämta sig och bygga upp sina liv igen.
   

  

 I slutet av 2019 öppnade IRC en verksamhet i Sverige med målet att skapa engagemang och öka kunskapen om humanitära kriser, påverka den svenska politiken och samla in medel från allmänheten i Sverige. Vi är för närvarande 18 anställda på vårt kontor i Stockholm och har även Face-to-Face insamlingsteam.
   

  

 Nu söker vi dig som vill bli vår nya generalsekreterare och leda den svenska organisationen.
   

  

 Om rollen
   

  

 Som Generalsekreterare Kommer Du Att Ha Det Övergripande Ansvaret För Att Leda Verksamheten Och Teamet i Sverige. Ett Stort Fokus Är På Att Samla In Medel Från Privatpersoner Och Privata Aktörer, Fördjupa IRC Sveriges Tillgång Till Statlig Finansiering i Sverige Och Andra Nordiska Länder Samt Att Öka IRC Sveriges Politiska Inflytande På Den Nordiska Humanitära Agendan. Ditt Ansvar Är Bland Annat Att
   

  

* Leda och inspirera medarbetarna och skapa en högpresterande och trygg, inkluderande kultur.
* Fungera som en effektiv ambassadör och talesperson för IRC i Norden och bygga starka relationer med externa intressenter.
* Utveckla och implementera strategier för att stärka IRCs närvaro i Norden.
* Samarbeta med andra organisationer och myndigheter samt representera IRC i olika forum.
* Säkerställa kostnadseffektiv resursanvändning samt effektiva finansiella och operativa kontroller.


 Rollen rapporterar till IRC Sveriges styrelse och Senior Vice President IRC Europe. Din bas är i Stockholm, med visst resande internationellt.
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Har lång erfarenhet av att leda en verksamhet inom ideell sektor eller intresseorganisation i en internationell kontext.
* Är en inspirerande och trygg ledare.
* Är en duktig diplomat och förhandlare.
* Har dokumenterad erfarenhet av påverkansarbete och relationer med seniora intressenter.
* Har utmärkta diplomatiska och förhandlingsfärdigheter.
* Har djup kunskap om den svenska och nordiska NGO- och biståndssektorn.
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i såväl engelska som svenska.


 För att trivas i rollen krävs ett djupt engagemang för IRCs uppdrag och värderingar och förmåga att verka i en global matrisorganisation.
   

  

 Du hittar den fullständiga rollbeskrivningen på engelska nedan.
   

  

 Intresserad?
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan på engelska via länken. Bifoga ditt CV och ett kort personligt brev där du motiverar varför du är intresserad av rollen.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag är den 14 augusti.
   

  

 Om du har specifika frågor om tjänsten kan du skicka ett mejl på engelska till: Marie.Subaran@rescue-uk.org
   

  

 IRC värdesätter mångfald hos våra medarbetare och ser värdet av samarbete mellan individer som kommer från olika bakgrunder, kompetenser och perspektiv. Vi strävar efter att vara en mångkulturell organisation och arbetar aktivt med likabehandling, mångfald och att skapa en socialt hållbar organisation för alla våra medarbetare. IRC Sverige har kollektivavtal och alla anställda omfattas av kollektivavtalade försäkringar och pensioner. Vi tillämpar ett flexibelt arbetssätt med krav på att vara på kontoret minst två dagar per vecka. För att arbeta hos oss behöver du stå bakom IRCs arbete och värderingar.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Job Description**
 BACKGROUND
   

  

 Founded in 1933 at the request of Albert Einstein, the International Rescue Committee is an international humanitarian organsiation with operations in over 40 countries worldwide. Our mission is to help people affected by conflict or disaster to survive, recover and rebuild their lives.
   

  

 The IRC global network which has its headquarters in New York and is on the ground in more than 40 countries providing emergency relief, relocating refugees and rebuilding lives in the wake of disaster. Through over 20 regional offices in cities across the United States the IRC also helps refugees resettle in the US and become self-sufficient.
   

  

 IRC Sverige, was established in 2019 to raise private funds and build presence in Sweden and is a registered NGO in Sweden. It now consists of over 20 staff and a team of face to face marketeers. Over the next five years’ the plan is to augment this presence by increasing mass market fundraising achieve IRC’s policy ambitions in the Nordics more effectively, maximizing funding from Sida, and cultivate relationships with governmental and high value private donors across the Nordic region.
   

  

 IRC Sweden is part of IRC in Europe, which employs over 500 staff across the UK, Germany, Belgium Switzerland, and Sweden.
   

  

 THE PURPOSE OF THE ROLE
   

  

 The Executive Director will establish and lead IRC Sverige in its journey of raising funds from individuals private actors, deepen IRC’s access to statutory funding in Sweden and other Nordics; and augment IRC’s policy and advocacy influence on the Nordic humanitarian agenda.
   

  

 The role, reporting to the Board and to the Senior Vice President, IRC Europe, provides organisational leadership and accountability to IRC Sverige and works closely with members of the IRC Senior Leadership Team for Europe to form and implement organizational objectives.
   

  

**Key Accountabilities**
 Leadership
   

  

* Provide inspirational and effective leadership of IRC Sverige and embed a high performing culture, that brings together contribution from all IRC functions represented in IRC Sverige
* Provide effective and collaborative matrix management along with colleagues in global functions
* Create sustainable and effective internal structures between global functional departments and IRC Sverige


 Stakeholder Engagement
   

  

* Act as an effective ambassador with external stakeholders including policy makers, governmental donors and high value private donor across the Nordic region.
* Be the key spokesperson for IRC in the Nordics and effectively engage with all media and opinion-forming organisations to protect and enhance the reputation of IRC.
* Build strong working relationships / partnerships with relevant high-level counterparts and key peers in the Nordic NGO Community.
* Take overall accountability for achieving agreed performance measures for IRC Sverige including private and public fundraising and advocacy.


 Planning, Delivery and Performance
   

  

* Take overall accountability for the effectiveness of the IRC Sverige operating model to ensure quality, service and cost-effective management of resources
* Contribute to the Europe strategy process by coordinating input from IRC Sverige as required by the SVP Europe
* Governance
* The Executive Director reports to the IRC Sverige Board and to the Senior Vice President, IRC Europe
* Represent IRC Sverige at the Europe Senior Leadership Team (SLT) meetings.
* Report to the IRC Sverige Board and prepare Board meetings.
* Leads the IRC Sweden team key roles
* Ensure effective financial and operational controls are in place for the organisation including systems to ensure fundraising operates on a highly ethical basis.
* Oversee an appropriate risk management culture and process


 PERSON SPECIFICATION
   

  

**Essential**
* Significant experience in leading, managing and executing across complex Non Governmental Organisation (NGOs) including leading Senior Management Teams.
* Flexibility and the ability to thrive in a global matrixed environment.
* Track record of advocacy and influencing senior stakeholders across government, business and other not-for-profit organisations.
* Ability to build strong relationships across a complex, matrixed stakeholder map evidenced by moving stakeholder groups to action.
* Excellent diplomatic and negotiation skills.
* Deep knowledge of the Swedish and good knowledge of other Nordic not-for-profit and policy environments
* Deep commitment to IRC’s mission and values including diversity, equality and inclusion
* Fluent professional English and Swedish language skills


 Desirable
   

  

* Experience in an executive leadership position in an international NGO organisation.
* Experience in the international aid sector


**Please place your application by 18.08.2024**
 Standard of Professional Conduct:The IRC and the IRC workers must adhere to the values and principles outlined in the IRC Way – our Code of Conduct. These are Integrity, Service, Accountability, and Equality.
   

  

 Commitment to Gender, Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion: The IRC is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, respectful, and safe work environment where all persons are treated fairly, with dignity and respect. The IRC expressly prohibits and will not tolerate discrimination, harassment, retaliation, or bullying of the IRC persons in any work setting. We aim to increase the representation of women, people that are from country and communities we serve, and people who identify as races and ethnicities that are under-represented in global power structures.

title: Tax Manager
description:
We are seeking for a Tax Manager Northern Europe to join our Finance team.
 



 You will report to the Financial Director Northern Europe and will be based in Stockholm.
 



  





 In this stimulating and challenging role, which is new, you will work with skilled and dedicated colleagues in a workplace characterized by openness and high ambitions. We offer great opportunities for professional development within the Group.
 



  





**Your responsibilities** 




  





 As the Tax Manager Northern Europe, you will be responsible for all tax matters in Norway and Sweden and provide support to our businesses in Denmark, Iceland and the Baltics in tax related tasks.
 



  




* Provide tax planning, tax reporting and tax compliance follow-up for Northern Europe in line with requirements from Heidelberg Material Group and Financial Director Northern Europe
* Responsible for all tax returns in Swedish and Norwegian companies, including questions and inquiries from tax authorities on tax returns and/or related to tax audits
* Assist Shared Service Center Northen Europe in tax calculations
* Responsible for training and implementation of a new tax reporting tools in Northern Europe, provided by Heidelberg Material Group
* Responsible for Transfer Price documentation in Sweden and Norway
* Supervisory responsibility for tax returns, tax compliance, Transfer Price documentation and tax audits in Denmark, Iceland and the Baltics
* Monitoring Tax risks in the region
* In charge for reconciliation of Northern Europe consolidated tax accounts in each legal closing, in Operating Plan and in Forecasts, including related documentation
* Active participation in optimizing legal structure for tax and/or dividend flow purposes



  





**Your profile** 




  





 We believe that the ideal candidate for this position has a relevant university degree together with 5 -7 years of experiences from tax related matters and solid knowledge about Swedish and/or Norwegian tax rules and regulations. Relevant experience could be working with tax at a large corporation or a consultancy firm. If you have worked in an international organization, it is seen as an advantage. Good communication- and presentation -skills in English is required, both written and verbal. Swedish is preferred.
 



  





 As a person you are driven and energetic with strong sense of cooperation and responsibility. You execute your commitments effectively and by doing so you build good relationships with stakeholders. Your strong business acumen, your high integrity and your social skills will make you successful in this role. Interest to drive cross-function/border projects is a plus.
 



  





**We offer** 



* Competitive terms
* Great career opportunities in a global company International and dynamic environment
* Proper emphasis on work-life balance
* A pleasant and social working environment with low turnover
* Internal development and networking programs
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm
* Competitive Pension and insurance schemes



  





 Read more about working at Heidelberg Materials,
 



 https://www.cement.heidelbergmaterials.se/sv/jobba-hos-oss
 



  





**Is this you?** 




 If you are interested in this position, you are welcome to send in your application as soon as possible, 20th of August at the latest. In this recruitment Heidelberg Materials is cooperating with Jefferson Wells Finance. If you have any questions don’t hesitate to contact Recruitment Consultant Malin Magnusson 076-780 68 64.
 



  





 Heidelberg Materials är en av världens största byggmaterialtillverkare. Med ledande marknadspositioner inom cement, ballast och betong erbjuder vi byggmaterial och lösningar genom hela värdekedjan. Vi har verksamhet i fler än 50 länder med över 51 000 medarbetare på närmare 3 000 platser. Kärnan i våra aktiviteter bygger på ansvar för miljön. Som en föregångare på vägen mot klimatneutralitet och en cirkulär ekonomi i byggmaterialindustrin, arbetar vi för att utveckla hållbara byggmaterial och lösningar för framtiden. Genom digitalisering erbjuder vi våra kunder nya möjligheter.

title: Content Marketing Manager
description:
***Oneflow builds a SaaS contract automation platform to help businesses modernize the legacy way of working with contracts. Oneflow has since April 2022 traded on Stockholm’s Nasdaq First North Premier Growth Market and is a rapidly growing tech scale-up located in the heart of Stockholm. We have created a platform that automates the entire contract process from start to finish, all in one place. Turning clunky, static contracts into helpful, truly digital contracts that feel like magic.***




  





**This is you** 




 We're looking for a seasoned content marketing professional who’s a highly skilled writer to join our marketing team! You deeply understand B2B technologies and the intricacies of modern buyer behavior. You'll create engaging content, from writing insightful blogs to crafting copy for visual communications, with the goal to drive awareness and traffic to the website. Data is important to you to create compelling written content that educates and sets the tone in the market. Your expertise in orchestrating the right tools for the job, especially AI, will be crucial as you know when to leverage technology and when to add a human touch.
 



 In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to proactively plan, execute content strategies, and level up the content profession using AI. As a great storyteller with a pedagogical approach, your curiosity and intentional understanding of our target audiences will shine through in your work. If you're ready to make a significant impact and help shape the B2B content landscape, we'd love to hear from you!
 



  





**What you’ll do** 



* Content creation: Write and publish high-quality, engaging B2B content in various formats across our digital channels. This can include, but not limited to, the Oneflow blog, promotional copy for ads and social media, guest blogs, newsletters, etc. with the goal to increase traffic and engagement.
* Thought leadership and SEO: Take ownership of the Oneflow blog through consistently publishing written content to build audience and drive traffic from digital channels, utilizing knowledge in distribution strategies and leveraging AI to improve output.
* Search optimization: Continuously optimize content for search, workflows, and processes to adapt to changing buyer behavior in searching for information.
* Strategy development: Lead, create and execute effective B2B content marketing strategies across our digital channels—owned and paid—to drive growth and engagement.
* Automation: Implement and optimize automation tools and generative AI technologies for content creation, distribution, and publishing workflows.
* Performance analysis: Utilize analytics tools to analyze content performance, identify trends, and gather insights to enhance content strategies.



  





**Skills and requirements** 



* At least 5 years of experience in the B2B content marketing profession with demonstrated experience in leading and developing impactful B2B content strategies for promoting written content across various digital channels
* Deep industry knowledge in content marketing and a proven track record of driving growth through written content at scale
* Experience from SEO and technical copywriting – it is excellent if you are well versed in the tech industry and SaaS, the B2B buying process, the market trends surrounding our target markets
* Demonstrated ability to build an audience, in at least one specific channel of owned media such as blogs, newsletters or podcasts
* Demonstrated experience using prompts or technical proficiency in automation tools and generative AI technologies to scale content effectiveness
* Experience in automating content creation, distribution, and publishing workflows, and a genuine interest in generative AI technologies
* Proven track record in leveraging analytics tools for content analysis, continuous improvement of content performance, and identifying trends and insights
* Excellent writing skills in English



  





**Come work with us** 




 We value gender equality and diversity in organization, so we strive for a team that reflects the diversity in today's society. At Oneflow we encourage and welcome applicants who are people of color, LGBTQI+, people with disabilities and those without a college degree. Our recruitment is based on competence.
 



 The recruitment process starts with an interview with Aleksandra from the People & Culture team. After that, you will complete a personality and logic test, then prepare an assignment before your final interview with Ling and Monica.
 



 We’re excited to meet you! 💜

title: Samsung - Performance Marketing Lead
description:
**Want to change the world? Join the team!** 




  





 A world-class brand is built on world-class people. At Samsung, we have a simple philosophy. We use talent and technology to create products that contribute to a better global society. But nothing is possible without skilled and committed employees who drive and realize the philosophy. It means everyone who works for Samsung is crucial to our success. You are welcome to apply - that might change the future, yours and ours!
 



  





 We are looking for a highly engaged and organized new Performance Marketing Lead with a passion for driving eCommerce results. The Performance Marketing Lead will be part of the Nordic D2C (direct-to-consumer) Marketing Team and will play a key role in developing the traffic acquisition to samsung.com. As a Performance Marketing Lead you will be responsible for planning, executing, improving and optimizing paid marketing activities, including SEM, Social, Display, Affiliate etc. In this role you will work closely with the Nordic eStore Team and the Category Marketing Teams.
 



  





**Main tasks & responsibilities include, but are not limited to:** 



* Works with the Nordic eStore Team, local media agency, Category Marketing Teams and European Office to maximize Samsung.com commercial results with the given media budget
* Develop best in class media strategy for the Nordic markets in collaboration with the above-mentioned stakeholders
* Responsible for eCommerce media budget and PO management
* PIC for the full media process from briefing to implementation and KPI analysis
* Key point of contact for the day-to-day management of the agency
* Implement and review cross-channel media to maximize sales results of campaigns and new product launches
* Oversee assets creation and localization
* Accountable for eCommerce traffic and revenue targets by driving media efficiency
* Define media investment and channel mix to ensure digital performance marketing success
* Analyze campaign performance and report learnings to optimize future strategies



  





**Experience:** 



* At least 3-5 years’ experience of working with eCommerce traffic acquisition and digital marketing
* Deep knowledge of digital marketing, experience in digital media planning and good knowledge of common media platforms and formats, such as Google Marketing Platform, Meta, TikTok, Snap, Affiliate Marketing platforms and Product Feed Management solutions
* Strong analytical skills and knowledge in both Adobe Analytics and Google Analytics to secure data-driven decision making
* Excellent understanding of the relevant KPI's and how these can be optimized over time
* Ability to interrogate local market plans to ensure they are best in class and deliver against both brand and commercial objectives
* A creative mindset and good understanding how to reach out to different target audiences
* Very strong project management skills and confident in working with many stakeholders on multiple projects at the same time
* Experience in handling media budgets for more than one country is a plus
* Great communication skills and the ability to build new relationships, a true teamplayer with a positive and solution-oriented “can-do”-attitude
* Fluency in English, Nordic languages are a plus



  





**About Samsung Electronics:** 




 Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. is a global leader in technology, opening new possibilities for people everywhere. Through relentless innovation and discovery, we are transforming the worlds of TVs, smartphones, tablets, PCs, cameras, home appliances, printers, LTE systems, medical devices, semiconductors and LED solutions. We employ 286,000 people across 80 countries with annual sales of US$269.billion. To discover more, please visit www.samsung.com.
 



  





**How to apply:** 




 In this recruitment process, Samsung is working with Academic Search. For more question, please contact Researcher, Ella Johansson ella.johansson@academicsearch.se. You apply by clicking on the ”Apply now” button below, where you enter your personal details, enclose CV and cover letter written in English. All information is handled confidentially in accordance with Academic Search Integrity Policy as well as the new data protection act, GDPR. This means that we can only process applications coming through the applications system. Thank you for your understanding.
 



  





 Academic Search International is one of Scandinavia’s most merited companies within Executive Search & Interim Management. Our focus is people with documented manager- and specialist competences. We have close collaborations with national and international companies with strong brands and purpose. Our mission is to unite the best qualified candidates with the toughest challenges at the most interesting companies in Sweden. Our values are KNOWLEDGE, ENGAGEMENT, RESPONSIBILITY and COLLABORATION. Through these values, we make a difference in all our relationships. www.academicsearch.se

title: Senior Legal & Business Affairs Manager Content
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Senior Legal & Business Affairs Manager Content** 
 in our
 **Stockholm office** 
 – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The role** 
  

  

 You will be part of Viaplay Group’s cross-border legal function and report to Head of Legal & Business Affairs Content. You will act as a business partner to Viaplay Group’s Content team and Content Acquisition team, and you will be working in a creative and inspiring environment.
   

  

 You will, together with the lawyers in the Legal & Business Affairs Content team:
   

  

* Draft and negotiate content related agreements, such as programme production agreements, content acquisition agreements, format agreements, talent agreements, etc.
* Help build and develop effective relationships with external partners and key business stakeholders
* Together with relevant stakeholders, align content rights with sublicensing, sales and customer needs to ensure back-to-back mitigation of risks and maximizing opportunities.
* Assist with other legal matters and internal approvals related to content


**What We’re Looking For**
 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* 7+ years of work experience, including experience of negotiating and drafting commercial agreements
* Content experience, for example from working at a production company or a broadcaster/streaming service.
* Excellent English skills, both written and verbal
* Being a solution-oriented team player with a strong ability to build relationships and deliver pragmatic legal advice to colleagues at all levels.
* Master of Law degree


**It’s a bonus if you have:**
* Another Nordic language (in addition to Swedish)
* Media union experience
* A can-do attitude and a good sense of humor.


**What We Offer You**
**We’ve got you covered!** 
 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
   

  

**Your wellbeing matters.** 
 We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
   

  

**A safe space to grow and up-skill.** 
 Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
   

  

**Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do** 
 . So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including series & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.
   

  

**Hit play today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Building Services Leader - Nordic and Baltic Zone
company: Oil and Gas Job Search Ltd
description:
Are you ready to take charge and drive success in Digital Energy within the Nordic Baltic Zone? We are searching for a passionate leader to inspire and guide our team, turning our vision into a shared mission. If you're excited about taking on this challenge and making a significant impact within Schneider Electric, we want to hear from you! Join us in shaping the future of energy management and automation.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
 As a key member of our Nordic management team, reporting to the VP Digital Energy Nordic Baltic Zone, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the strategic direction of the services business in the region. Your focus will be on driving performance, providing support to countries, and leading future business development.
   

  

* Develop and implement the regional services strategy, concentrating on performance and future business development in alignment with company goals.
* Oversee the P&L of the services organization in the Nordic Baltic zone, emphasizing country support and operational excellence
* Prioritize customer satisfaction and loyalty through exceptional service delivery, strong customer connections, and initiatives that enhance customer retention.
* Drive operational efficiency by streamlining processes and resources, supporting countries to deliver services efficiently while maintaining high quality.
* Lead the development of a high-performing team of service professionals, setting performance objectives and nurturing a culture of high performance.


**What We Are Looking For**
* Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Business Administration, Engineering, or a relevant field.
* Experience in leadership within the services industry, focusing on aligning service strategies with company goals and driving operational excellence.
* Proven track record of effectively managing P&L, achieving financial goals, and fostering a culture of high performance within teams.
* Fluent in English; knowledge of any Nordic language is advantageous.


 We are seeking a candidate with strong business acumen, financial expertise, and strategic insight to drive performance, support countries, and shape future business development. If you possess outstanding interpersonal, communication, and leadership skills, along with analytical and problem-solving abilities, we'd like to hear from you.
   

  

 The application period is open until the
 **25 th of August** 
 , and we will start reviewing candidates after the application period so don't expect feedback prior to this date. We thank you for your patience.
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?**
**About**
 Please submit your application soonest. We will fulfill the position as soon as the suitable candidate has been found. Read more about our Digital Energy Business:
   

  

 https://www.se.com/ww/en/work/campaign/buildings-of-the-future/
   

  

**Why us?**
 At Schneider Electric we're committed to creating a workplace that gives you not just a job but a
 **meaningful** 
 purpose in joining our mission to bring energy and efficiency to enable life, progress and sustainability for all.
   

  

 We believe in
 **e** 
**mpowering** 
 our team members to reach their full potential, fostering a sense of ownership in their work.
   

  

 We embrace
 **inclusion** 
 as a fundamental value, ensuring that every voice is heard and valued. We value differences, and welcome people from all walks of life. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone, everywhere.
   

  

 If you want to be part of a company where your contributions truly matter, where you are empowered to make a difference and where inclusivity is valued, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 Discover your
 **M** 
**eaningful, Inclusive** 
 and
 **Empowered** 
 career at Schneider Electric.
   

  

 ₠34.2bn global revenue
   

  

 +12% organic growth
   

  

 135 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   

  

 #1 on the Global 100 World's most sustainable corporations
   

  

 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled
   

  

 Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best.

 You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion here and our DEI Policy here

It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color , gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.

title: Del-Projektledare för Automations
description:
**Med människor i fokus och rötter i traditionell automation är vi en av Sveriges ledande leverantörer av resurseffektiviserande system för energi, infra och industri. Vi tar ett helhetsansvar för både stora och mindre projekt med el, kraft och automation. Vi levererar även hela anläggningar där vi utöver våra automationslösningar tar ett totalansvar - människor, montagelösningar och mekanik. Genom att kombinera projektförmåga, branschkunnande och teknisk kompetens, skapar vi framgång och utveckling för både medarbetare och kunder. Våra resurser har vi samlade i eget hus vilket ger oss en värdefull samverkan och kontinuitet i projekten. För oss handlar projektförmåga om att skapa konkurrenskraft åt och tillsammans med våra kunder. Överallt där industriproduktion effektiviseras och utvecklas har Granitor Systems en naturlig och viktig roll att spela.**
 Flera av våra kunder är i genomförandefasen av stora projekt och behöver förstärkning. Vi söker erfarna Del-projektledare med automationsingenjör bakgrund med erfarenhet av att arbeta med komplexa lösningar och ett stort intresse för processtyrsystem och teknik inom infrastruktur och industri.
   

  

 Du ska leda och driva Del-Projekt/investeringsprojekt inom Automation med placering hos vår kund i Stockholm.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Leda, driva och leverera Delprojekt inom ramen för Automation till uppsatta mål, avseende tid, scope, kvalitet och budget enligt investeringsprocessen
* Leda och styra delprojektmedlemmar och leverantörer/ entreprenörer inom ramen för Automation.
* Ansvara för att utreda och ta fram tekniska lösningar inom delprojektet utifrån behov, idéer och krav från kunder enligt direktiv från Projektägare.
* Säkerställa att den tekniska lösningen följer kundens och övriga krav
* Säkerställa/ta fram tekniska specifikationer och förfrågningsunderlag samt ansvara för utvärdering och upphandling i samråd med Projektledare och Inköp


**Att inom ramen för ett delprojekt ansvara för att:**
* ta fram budget, tids- och resursplan
* leda och driva sitt delprojekt enligt projektplan och hantera den dagliga styrningen
* identifiera samt hantera projekt- och EHS-risker
* rapportera till projektledare
* säkra samordning och kommunikation internt och externt
* hantera safety och EHS-frågor


**Kvalifikationer**
 Civilingenjör, högskoleingenjör med goda Delprojektledningserfarenheter och tekniska kunskaper inom (Automation) energi, processindustri eller produktionsutveckling/-tillverkning. God kunskap i och erfarenhet av upphandlingar,
   

  

 investeringskalkylering och entreprenadsjuridik samt inom arbetsmiljöområdet
   

  

 Arbetat inom kraftvärme- och energiindustri, tung processindustri, eller annan industriell verksamhet. Som person är du
   

  

 noggrann och systematisk, har ett intresse för projektledning/teknik och ekonomi, samt god samarbetsförmåga. Du är
   

  

 bekväm med att ta eget ansvar och omsätta idéer till nya och förbättrade arbetsmetoder.
   

  

**Kunskaper/krav inom Automation / Process**
 Har goda kunskaper och förståelse för Automation/Process inom kraft-och värmeproduktion.
   

  

 Samt goda kunskaper och förståelse för instrumentering/reglering samt för modern It-teknik. Främst kommunikationsteknik, virtuella nätverk och virtuella servers. Vi ser gärna specifikt goda kunskaper och förståelse för moderna DCS-system så som ABB 800xA, Siemens PCS7/T3000 även SCADA-system/PLC för Fastighetssystem.
   

  

* samt att för våra leverantörer kunna beskriva hur vi avser att implementera tekniken i våra anläggningar och att leda/medverka vid idrifttagningar.
* Vana vid framtagning och/eller kravställning av objektlistor, funktionsbeskrivningar och andra underlag för att beskriva omfattning och funktion samt att kunna verifiering leveransen mot kravställningen (övrig kravställning ser jag som generell för DPL och inte specifik för Automation)
* Ett upparbetat nätverk med möjliga leverantörer av Automations entreprenader kan vara ett plus.
* Goda kunskaper i Svenska/engelska i tal o skrift
* Körkort


 Vi tror jag att en person som ska kunna motsvara kraven måste ha minimum 5-10 års erfarenhet av Automation, inte nödvändigtvis bara som Delprojektledare/automations Ing.
   

  

**Bra Att Veta**
 Placering: Stockholm
   

  

 Omfattning: heltidstjänst
   

  

 Säkerhetsprövning: Säkerhetsprövning och genomförande av registerkontroll av kandidaten kan förkomma
   

  

 Tjänsteresor förekommer.
   

  

**Kontaktperson**
 Siamak Hashemi (Gruppchef), siamak.hashemi@granitor.se
   

  

**Rekryteringsprocess**
 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så sök nu!
   

  

 Granitor är en svensk företagsgrupp som är verksam inom fastighetsutveckling och förvaltning, entreprenad, konsult och service samt tillväxtinvesteringar i utvecklingsbolag. Här jobbar 4400 samhälls- och industriutvecklare och omsättningen under 2020 var 7,5 miljarder kronor. Den 12 januari 2022 bytte vi namn från Midroc till Granitor. I över 25 år har vi, tillsammans med kunder och partners, utvecklat hållbara lösningar för samhälle och industri. Vår ambition är att bidra till en bättre framtid – både idag och för kommande generationer.

title: Commercial/Pricing Strategy & Planning - Experienced Professional
company: Oil and Gas Job Search Ltd
description:
**Pricing Data Analyst - Great people make Schneider Electric a great company.**
**Are you passionate about converting complex data into useful insights so that management can make data-driven decisions?**
**Then come and make a difference to our business as a pricing data analyst at Schneider Electric.**
 As a data analyst in Schneider Electric, you will have a diverse portfolio of tasks and you will set the foundation and future direction for a data driven approach of the department. As part of the Pricing department you will be reporting to the Pricing Director Nordic Baltic and will be working across several countries. The Pricing organization is recently unified in the Nordics and Baltics countries, but with a local presence - this means that you will get the best of two worlds. Be locally stationed in a young and dynamic environment with flexibility and strong use of digital platforms for collaboration across countries as you are also building an international network.
   

  

**Exciting Tasks And Responsibilities Await You**
 In the role of Pricing data analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing the effect of changes in price strategy and price adjustments. With strong analytical and operational experience, you collect and analyze data and translate it into useful knowledge and recommendations.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who is analytical effective, a team player and a strong communicator that is able to deal with ambiguity. You challenge status quo, focus on continuous improvement and results, and are part of a team that connect and collaborate with people across country boarders and functions. You present figures and findings to stakeholders, thereby helping them to make optimal business and data-driven decisions.
   

  

 This position is accountable for tasks related to the two following areas:
   

  

**General Data Analysis Topics**
* Data transfers and clean-ups
* Link data from various sources
* Understand business requirements for tools
* Build, maintain and develop models
* Adapt global tools to local requirements
* Build fit for purpose dashboards
* Be the subject matter expert for Data


 Pricing specific topics executed through any of the above methods:
   

  

* Simulate changes in price structure on variance, profitability and volume
* Build simulation tools to analyze various price scenarios across channels, partner categories, customer and product levels
* Analyze the impact of price/discount adjustments on margin
* Track pricing KPIs and highlight potential opportunities
* Translate data into analytical insights and recommendations
* Evaluate price-volume tradeoff
* Report metrics to the rest of organization (sales, marketing)
* Follow market trends and competitors' data
* Support the organization with the ongoing business transformation


**Pricing Data Analyst Requirements**
 We know skills and competencies show up in many different ways and can be based on your life experience. If you do not necessarily meet all the requirements that are listed, we still encourage you to apply for the position.
   

  

**Preferred Requirements**
* Ability to master big data and tools is the most critical requirement together with the ability to translate complex analytics into easy-to understand and visual insights for the business
* In-depth knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis.
* Relevant degree in mathematics, statistics, finance, economics, or in a related field.
* Experience in collaborating with sales and marketing departments is preferable
* Ability to present pricing analysis reports to relevant stakeholders.
* Excellent analytical and communication skills.
* Professional use of MS Excel, Power Pivot and Tableau. Experience with price optimization software is a plus.


 You will have ample opportunity to make a difference to our business, and since the position is new, you will also have very good opportunities to shape the direction, influence the longer-term tasks and make an impact.
   

  

**We offer you** 
 With us, you will get an attractive position in an international group, where community, professionalism and development are highly valued. We always have a strong focus on employee satisfaction and have a good and equal working environment that makes going to work fun. We believe in personal growth, having fun at work, to embrace differences in opinion, in a good work/life balance whilst at the same making a difference.
   

  

 The organization is undergoing rapid development and you will have a varied and professionally challenging job with the opportunity to influence, also on the design of the position.
   

  

**In Addition, We Offer You**
 An onboarding program which ensures that you get off to the best possible start
   

  

 Good pension scheme, health insurance and lunch scheme as well as other employee benefits
   

  

 Ongoing training opportunities and a focus on personal and professional development
   

  

 Flexibility in relation to working hours
   

  

**Let us learn about you! Apply today.**
**You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.**

 At Schneider Electric we're committed to creating a workplace that gives you not just a job but a
 **meaningful**

 **e**

 our team members to reach their full potential, fostering a sense of ownership in their work.

 **inclusion** 
 as a fundamental value, ensuring that every voice is heard and valued. We value differences, and welcome people from all walks of life. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone, everywhere.

title: Senior redovisningsekonom till ett hållbarhetsinriktat företag!
description:
Är du en erfaren redovisningsekonom som vill bli en del av ett företag som strävar efter att bidra och skapa en hållbar framtid för alla? Vi jobbar med löpande urval så ta chansen och ansök redan idag!
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Ekonomi/juridik/inköp
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, långsiktigt uppdrag
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Början av september
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Vi på Academic Work söker nu för vår kunds räkning en senior redovisningsekonom. Vår kund är ett hållbarhetsinriktat fondbolag som fokuserar på att investera i tillgångar och växande verksamheter. Bland annat har de investerat i flertal vatten- och vindkraftverk i Norden.
 


  


 Totalt är de 250 medarbetare i Europa och sitter 16 personer i Sverige varav 11 st på Stockholmskontoret. Det är 3 personer som jobbar med ekonomi i Stockholm men där du kommer ingå i ett Finance team som består av kollegor från Stockholm, London och Glasgow. Som redovisningsekonom kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att säkerställa att det dagliga ekonomiska processer fortsätter att flyta smidigt.
 


  


 Detta är ett långsiktigt uppdrag via oss på Academic Work, om alla parter är nöjda med samarbetet finns goda chanser till överrekrytering.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Värdefull kunskap och erfarenhet inom hållbarhetsområdet
  
* En flexibel arbetspolicy med 50% kontorsnärvaro
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**

 Med rapportering till Senior Finance Manager i Stockholm, är detta en position som spelar en väsentlig roll i de dagliga redovisnings- och finansaktiviteterna inom detta snabbrörliga och växande företag. Ekonomiteamet består för närvarande av 11 medlemmar belägna i London, Glasgow och Stockholm och förväntas fortsätta växa under det kommande året.
 


  

  
* Löpande redovisning
  
* Kund- och leverantörsreskontra
  
* Materiella/immateriella tillgångar och avskrivningar
  
* Utföra månads- och kvartalsrapportering
  
* Delta i årsavslut inklusive årsrapporter
  
* Stödja resten av vårt ekonomiteam i bokslutsaktiviteter
  
* Moms- och deklaration rapportering
  
* Arbeta med processförbättringar inklusive implementering av nya IT-system
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en akademisk examen i ekonomi eller liknande
  
* Har minst 2-3 års redovisningserfarenhet, kan självständigt utföra månads- och kvartalsrapportering
  
* Har mycket god kunskap inom MS Office, speciellt Excel
  
* Har erfarenhet av Microsoft Dynamics, detta är fördelaktigt men inte ett krav
  
* Kommunicerar flytande i tal och skrift i det svenska och engelska språket då det används i det dagliga arbetet
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har:**



  

  
* Norsk redovisningserfarenhet, kan regler inom skatt och liknande samt det norska språket
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är**
 strukturerad, noggrann och har en förmåga att ta initiativ och erbjuda snabb hjälp där det behövs. Vidare är du en entusiastisk och motiverad lagspelare som är angelägen att uppnå resultat och att möta deadlines med hög kvalitet på output.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Linnea Molnar eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv5@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105852

title: Global Tax Manager
description:
**Are you our new driven Global Tax Manager?** 




 As a market-leading credit management and investment company, Intrum has wide-ranging expertise in debt collection services, and we do business in 20 countries in Europe. We have roughly 10,000 experienced employees in our group. The company is listed on the Swedish stock exchange, global headquarters are in Stockholm and has Nordic Capital as a major investor.
 



  





**Why Intrum?** 




 Working for us means working for the international market leader. That sounds great. It also means working with the best people, the most exciting clients, the latest market innovations and the highest ethical standards.
 



 Our business is about helping others. Helping individuals in debt get out of difficult situations. Assisting companies to get paid, so they can grow, employ and prosper. Which in turn is positive for the whole economy. You become an essential part of this circuit with us, which gives your job at Intrum a deeper meaning, regardless of your role or title.
 



 In recent years, Intrum has consolidated its market leading position within credit management in Europe and now the company wishes to create efficiency in processes and benefit from economies of scale. Intrum is covering 98% of the European NPL stock with operations in 20 countries and holding a leading position in the majority of those geographies. With headquarter in Stockholm and a leading franchise across Europe, the candidate has many opportunities to work with complex tax issues across numerous jurisdictions. Moreover, Intrum is a leading investor in portfolios of overdue receivables and similar claims, creating unique and exciting tax challenges.
 



 The company is aware of its responsibility to society and the public attention towards the financial services industry and continues to live its purpose of leading the way to a sound economy through the values: Empathy, Ethics, Dedication and Solutions.
 



  





  





**The role** 
 will be a key member of the Global Finance team, working closely with the rest of the Global Tax team and local Finance Directors across Europe.
 



  





**Location for this position:** 




 Stockholm, Sweden. Additionally, we fully encourage a hybrid working model. We see that hybrid work, where we as employees can work either from home or from the office, creates opportunities to perform and work effectively in virtual and real environments. We do not offer relocation support or work permit sponsorship.
 



  





**Your key responsibilities will be** 



* Act as key point of contact to provide technical and strategic advice on tax accounting, reporting and related queries across all jurisdictions of the group, working with local finance and legal teams as well as external advisors
* Lead, develop and implement key tax strategies and risk mitigation measures, especially related to tax accounting issues connected to OECD Pillar 2 compliance
* Review and analyse tax reporting and develop new and improved processes
* Forecasting and analysis of the Group’s effective tax rate and cash taxes across all jurisdictions
* Analyse and advise on tax rates to be used in investment decisions
* Ensure quality of group level tax accounting and external reporting
* Provide support to, primarily, the Swedish entities of the group regarding tax calculations and tax return processes, focusing especially on interest limitation rules
* Provide tax support in relation to our ongoing ERP transformation
* Participate in M&A and investment transactions, working with tax and structuring related workstreams
* Monitor key international tax trends, especially in relation to financial services, investments and asset management and be able to operationalize these trends together with our Investments Finance team
* Partake in ongoing Tax Audits, legal processes and queries across all jurisdictions
* Provide ad hoc tax advice and participate in groupwide transformation projects



  





**What can we offer you:** 




**We lead the way** 




 Intrum’s purpose is to lead the way to a sound economy, and our core values;
 **Empathy** 
 ,
 **Ethics** 
 ,
 **Dedication** 
 and
 **Solutions** 
 guides us in our daily work.
 



  





 To lead the way, we have extraordinary people. People who want to make a difference. People who want to see change have a vision and don’t mind going the extra mile to get the result. We see opportunities where others see difficulties; we see challenges where others see problems.
 



  





**Having the opportunity to grow** 




 In our organisation, there are many opportunities to advance, specialise and broaden your knowledge or even try your wings abroad. It’s up to you to make it happen. The fact that our business is about helping others - individuals and companies, makes your work develop on a more personal level, too. Simply put, you will grow by making a difference.
 



  





**Your qualifications** 




**We think you have** 



* A relevant university degree, preferably a master’s degree in business or law
* 4-8 years from a similar role, preferably from a Big 4 accounting firm or similar inhouse role in a multinational corporation
* Significant knowledge and experience in Tax Accounting, Tax Controlling and Financial Reporting
* Significant knowledge and experience in Tax Compliance for public, multinational companies
* Excellent communication skills, written and oral in English
* We expect all our applicants to have orderly finances
* In addition, the following qualifications are considered beneficial, but not mandatory:
* Experience working with M&A and complex multinational investment structures
* Financial services or asset management experience
* Experience working with ERP systems



  





**Who you are** 




 You operate according to our values:
 



 Empathy​, Ethics​, Dedication​, Solutions – that means that you would be a good match if you recognise yourself within the following:
 


* You have an Inclusive mindset; you are open-minded and flexible
* You show initiative, offering your efforts to collaborate in projects and always looking forward to improving your performance
* You focus on results, with quality and professionalism
* You are an inspiration because you show commitment and accountability
* You continuously improve your personal experience, acquire new knowledge and skills
* You constantly are in search of further information, trends and maintaining the forefront expert
* You seek and experiment with new ideas and approaches that improve current processes and products
* You understand the needs and complexities of the global environment



  





**Are you curious and have questions?** 




  





 You’re welcome to contact Global Tax Manager, Ted Johnson, Ted.Johnson@intrum.com. for more information

title: Territory Sales Manager Joint Replacement (Hips, Knees & Mako Robotic-Assisted Surgery) | Stockholm & Uppland
description:
We are excited to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces by Fortune Magazine!
   

  

 We are proud to offer you our total rewards package which includes bonuses, healthcare, insurance benefits, retirement programs, wellness programs, as well as service and performance awards – not to mention various social and recreational activities, all of which are location specific.
   

  

**The Job’s Mission:**
 As a
 **Territory Sales Manager,** 
 you will help us deliver on our mission of making healthcare better by promoting and selling Stryker’s
 **Joint Replacement** 
 product portfolio – in the regions of
 **Stockholm and Uppland.**
 Our Joint Replacement division offers market-leading implants for the hip and knee that help improve patient and hospital outcomes with procedural excellence. Additionally, in this position, you will support the sales cycle of our innovative Mako Robotics in your respective region. The Mako robot enables surgeons to have a more predictable surgical experience and shorter recovery times for patients compared to manual hip/knee procedures.
   

  

* Find out more about our Joint Replacement products: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/portfolios/orthopaedics/joint-replacement.html
* Find out more about the Mako Robot: https://bit.ly/3A12reb


 If you are passionate about healthcare, this is a great opportunity to join one of the largest medical technology organizations in the world!
   

  

**Your key responsibilities:**
* In your new role, you will start with a familiarization phase with product trainings to learn about the product portfolio and develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
* You will identify, analyze and prospect new customers, while providing ongoing service to existing customers.
* You will plan and implement strategies in the sales process and conduct negotiations including with surgeons, hospital administration and purchasing departments.
* With the product knowledge you have built up, you advise and train medical and surgical professionals on its use during demonstrations. You will also provide clinical support in the operating room when needed.
* You will participate congresses, seminars and business meetings to identify potential new customers and to expand your knowledge for customer contact.
* You will prepare orders for interested customers and be a reliable partner for our customers during order follow-up.
* Furthermore, you will work closely with other team members in Sweden and the Sales Manager – to ensure customer service levels are best in class.


**What are we looking for?**
* You already have demonstrable sales experience in industries such as MedTech, Pharmaceuticals, BioTech, healthcare or related.
* Orthopedics/anatomy knowledge is not mandatory, but it is an advantage.
* You hold a diploma/degree, preferably in fields such as business administration, physiotherapy, nursing, sciences, healthcare or in any other relevant areas or technical career.
* Excellent communication skills with proficiency in spoken and written English and Swedish is required.
* You hold a valid driver’s license as this position involves regular customer visits.


**Competencies:**
* Drive: you have a strong enthusiasm for medical technology – your resilience and passion for selling complex products with the best possible customer service is very important to you!
* Relationship building and interpersonal skills: you appreciate contact with a wide variety of people and have a talent for building and maintaining connections.
* Empathy: you understand our customers’ needs to support our mission of making healthcare better!


**What do we offer?**
* We grow talent: we offer great personal and internal career development for our employees, with the possibility to make both vertical and lateral position movement.
* Quality products that improve the lives of our customers and patients.
* Competitive salary: with us, you will receive a competitive salary package and benefits including an attractive pension plan.
* Co-workers committed to collaboration and winning the right way.
* Recognition of your performance: at Stryker, outstanding individual and cross-functional team performance is rewarded. Ideas, projects, or other exceptional achievements can be submitted for various awards on a local and global level.
* Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your career.
* Flat hierarchies and a culture driven to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results.


 Stryker is a global leader in medical technologies and, together with its customers, is driven to make healthcare better. The company offers innovative products and services in MedSurg, Neurotechnology, Orthopaedics and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 150 million patients annually.
